meanings.definition: A person who rides horses in races.
meanings.sent1: The jockeys raced their horses around the track.
meanings.sent2: The jockeys were skilled riders in the horse race.
meanings.sent3: The jockeys and their horses always make the crowd cheer.
meanings.sent4: In the world of horse racing, jockeys are like swift knights on their steeds.
meanings.sent5: The colorful uniforms of the jockeys fluttered in the wind as they rode.

meanings.definition: To maneuver or manipulate in a skillful manner.
meanings.sent1: She jockeys her way through the crowded market to find the best deals.
meanings.sent2: He jockeys the gears of the car smoothly to avoid any jerks.
meanings.sent3: The chef jockeys the ingredients together to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The politician jockeys his words carefully to win over the voters.
meanings.sent5: The skilled magician jockeys the cards with precision during the trick.
